text: Sweden will be competing at the 2020 Summer Paralympics in Tokyo, Japan, which will take place from 24 August to 5 September 2021. This will be their sixteenth consecutive appearance at the Summer Paralympics since 1960. == Archery == Sweden collected one quota place at the 2019 Para Archery World Championships held in Den Bosch, Netherlands. == Athletics == ;Men's field {|class=wikitable style="font-size:95%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="3"|Final |- !Result !Points !Rank |- |Per Jonsson |Men's long jump T13 | | | |} == Cycling == Sweden is scheduled to compete in cycling at the 2020 Summer Paralympics. == Shooting == Sweden qualified for the 2020 Summer Paralympics after their results at the 2018 World Shooting Para Sport Championships and the 2019 World Shooting Para Sport World Cup. The athletes that qualified for the 2020 Summer Paralympics are Bang Yu-Jeong, Joackim Norberg, Håkan Gustafsson, Philip Jonsson and Anna Normann. == Table tennis == Anna-Carin Ahlquist qualified to compete at the 2020 Summer Paralympics. == See also == * Sweden at the Paralympics * Sweden at the 2020 Summer Olympics == References == == External links == * 2020 Summer Paralympics website Category:Nations at the 2020 Summer Paralympics 2020 Summer Paralympics
title: Sweden at the 2020 Summer Paralympics
